timeline.message: Feat: adding the password confirmation. Fixing the ESLint errors
Working on the user and role table
Refactor: working on the role table modals
Refactor: Removing the debug logging and FIXME

timeline.bodyText: What's the FIXME in regards to?
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if you are intending to keep the logs here or not.
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.bodyText: Did we want to do a new line here?
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.bodyText: Can't you use the modified PopUp component here?
timeline.author: bamandel

replies.bodyText: This is defining the modified PopUp component
replies.author: jamesrichard91

timeline.bodyText: Would a ternary operator be allowed here or is it not allowed due to async functions?
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.bodyText: The formatting here is a little strange to me. Edit on its own line would be a little clearer
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.bodyText: Same as above. Looks strange having this on its own line.
timeline.author: bamandel
bamandel

timeline.bodyText: I think having the lines not starting with . makes more sense. My IDE was doing this to me automatically with the save actions. Perhaps you are having the same issue?
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.bodyText: more lines starting with a period
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.bodyText: Do we actually want this set to false here?
timeline.author: bamandel

replies.bodyText: Yes, we want to separate the inProgress and fetching booleans. I have separated our use of the two flags. InProgress now refers to a change being made to a User or Role (create, edit, delete) and fetching refers to retrieving them.
replies.author: jamesrichard91

timeline.bodyText: I think we want to negate the matching by default, otherwise, the user could save a blank password, no?
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: The only time we want to validate the passwords is if they have provided a value for either password field. If neither password field has been provided, we want to skip this because they may be updating some other User field.
replies.author: jamesrichard91

timeline.message: Refactor: Updating based on PR feedback.
Refactor: Adding the missing fetching booleans

timeline.bodyText: Should this be wrapped in parenthesis as well?
timeline.author: psantos1113

timeline.bodyText: Everywhere this component is used is wrapped in a form element correct? Otherwise the submit won't work.
timeline.author: psantos1113
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,20 +1,18 @@
 import React from 'react';
 import PropTypes from 'prop-types';
 
-const SubmitButton = ({ onClick, children, id }) => (
-    <button id={id} className="btn btn-md btn-primary" type="submit" onClick={onClick}>{children}</button>
+const SubmitButton = ({ children, id }) => (
+    <button id={id} className="btn btn-md btn-primary" type="submit">{children}</button>

replies.bodyText: yes, this is always part of a form. I added the onClick to master when working on this PR and that breaks a lot of things.
replies.author: jamesrichard91

timeline.message: Refactor: Wrapping the CancelButton in parenthesis.
